executive_summary: The Online Hotel Booking industry comprises establishments primarily providing hotel booking services via online platforms. These websites are third-party platforms for customers to research and make hotel reservations. Over the past five years, more individuals willing to make online reservations have benefited the industry. Nevertheless, the industry was hit by the unprecedented COVID-19 that led to a substantial decline in travel rates, causing industry revenue to fall sharply in 2020. As travel restrictions were lifted in 2021, revenue has recovered strongly due to the release of pent-up demand. Over the five years to 2024, industry revenue is expected to grow at an annualized rate of 2.8% to $51.8 billion, including a 6.5% growth in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Higher Internet Usage Drives Industry Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Before online hotel booking services, travelers relied on brick-and-mortar travel agencies or hotels to plan their trips. Nonetheless, an increasing number of internet users, coupled with more services conducted online, has bolstered demand for online booking services over the past five years.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: TRAVEL ACTIVITIES PLUMMETED IN 2020 DUE TO COVID-19
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The impact of COVID-19 was severe, with large swaths of the economies curtailed to slow the spread of the virus. In conjunction with plummeting consumer sentiment, travel restrictions weighed on travel considerably. The effects of the coronavirus pandemic have been detrimental to the Online Hotel Booking industry. In 2020 alone, the number of travelers in the United States declined by over 50.0%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE INDUSTRY IS HIGHLY RELIANT ON THE TRAVEL SECTOR
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As people travel, demand for accommodation rises, spurring demand for online hotel booking services. Before the pandemic, the travel sector surged as economic growth enabled people to splurge on discretionary spending, such as leisure and business trips. Although travel activities normalize after the pandemic subsides, downstream customers facing lower disposable income due to high inflation and unemployment have reduced travel spending, hurting industry demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: CONTINUED IMPROVEMENTS IN THE TRAVEL SECTOR WILL AID REVENUE GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Travel rates will strengthen during the outlook period when consumer confidence recovers. As inflation growth is anticipated to slow and unemployment is expected to fall, more individuals will feel confident

Although Airbnb's service offerings are slightly different, short-term apartment rentals have been favored by customers who travel in large groups like families and friends. Apartment rental is considered more cost-effective and enables customers to spend more time together while traveling. Other online short-term lodging rental services have been considered a direct substitute for online hotel booking services. They will likely lure away the industry's potential customers, placing pressure on industry demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Exchange Rate Fluctuations Pose A Risk
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The US dollar has strengthened over the past five years as global political conflicts induce investors to return to US dollars as a safe haven. Consequently, an appreciating dollars made travel to the United States relatively more expensive to foreign travelers, reducing their propensity to visit the United States. The US dollar will likely stabilize during the outlook period, allowing foreign travelers to better plan their trips. When the US dollar depreciates, more international visitors will plan their trips to the United States, benefiting the industry.

industry_definition: This industry includes establishments that make hotel reservations and bookings online. The industry excludes brick-and-mortar companies that provide hotel reservation services.
key_trends: The Online Hotel Booking industry has been growing due to the increasing use of the internet. The added convenience of online booking services has spurred demand for industry services over the past five years.

Increasing travel rates and a consistent rise in internet users will drive industry revenue during the outlook period. Nevertheless, the industry contends with growing competition from online rental platforms and a stable share of customers booking directly with hotels.
There is a limited amount of regulation specific to the Online Hotel Booking industry. Companies must comply with regulations pertaining to e-commerce and the broader travel sector.

Companies also must comply with international and state-specific laws. Other regulations include data privacy requirements, labor relations laws, nondiscrimination, human rights or anti-human-trafficking laws and regulations, anti-trust or competition laws and consumer protection laws.
Many companies offer ancillary services to enable customers to book full vacations with travel, dining reservations and other activities.
Demand has fallen slightly as customers reduce discretionary spending on travel when unemployment and inflation increase.

The industry suffered from significant declines in international travelers, causing domestic travelers to account for an overwhelming share of the revenue during the pandemic. As demand picks up, the international leisure segment has recovered.

Industry establishments are primarily online. However, companies are often located near critical downstream markets and upstream web developers to create and maintain search engines and access to hotels and accommodation providers.

The Mid-Atlantic region also holds a substantial amount of industry establishments. The high concentration is due to its concentration of key tourist destinations, such was New York City and Philadelphia.

Travelers are price sensitive since airfare and accommodation are discretionary purchases. Travel agencies compete fiercely on price in a highly saturated market where consumers are attracted to the best deal.

The emergence of do-it-yourself platforms is siphoning consumers away from online hotel booking companies. Vacation rental websites offer the direct booking of accommodation and activities while airlines and hotels incentivize consumers to book directly through loyalty and points programs.
There is no single company accounting for more than 5.0% of industry revenue.

Companies purchase office furniture, software, computers and peripheral equipment. Purchases' share of revenue has increased over the past five years as they are buying more computers and software to meet higher travel demand from customers.
The rise of personalized services is driving up wage costs. Employees of niche agencies have specialized knowledge of luxury travel or specific regions, which demands higher wages.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Domestic leisure travel aligns with overall economic trends, particularly disposable income and consumer spending. However, lower consumer confidence starting in 2022 has partially reduced demand for leisure trips.

Despite businesses book fewer hotels than household consumers, corporate customers often stay at higher-quality hotels, resulting in higher per-night revenue. Rising corporate profit has increased over the past five years, supporting spending on business travel.

International travel tends to follow trends in consumer spending and disposable income as these trips cost more than domestic travel. Despite strong international travel demand before the pandemic, travel restrictions and border closures amid the pandemic severely impaired demand from this segment in 2020. To the industry's benefit, international travel rates resurged in 2021 as restrictions were fully removed.
The industry also generates revenue from business advertisements and promoted accommodations and activities.

products_and_services.product_description: Hotels and Other Accommodations Make Up the Largest Portion of Industry Revenue
Apartment rental services, such as Vrbo, have increased as consumers have demanded additional amenities provided in apartments, such as private residences or a full kitchen.

Industry companies also offer additional services such as booking air travel, experiences and excursions, car rentals and dining. Companies often offer these services to facilitate additional purchases and become a one-stop shop for vacation planning. Rising income has supported demand for these additional products as consumers have had more money to book additional products and services for their trips. Some companies may also offer more personalized booking and travel agent services to further assist customers, travel insurance and other products and services.
Many companies also offer advertising space for hotels or activity providers.
Industry companies also offer booking air travel as an additional service.

tier_1_suppliers: Bed & Breakfast & Hostel Accommodations in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Internet Service Providers in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Online booking services can also take out much of the guesswork of booking travel and accommodations as consumers can compare options in the area and read reviews. Consumers often opt for the ease of online booking platforms as they can serve as a one-stop shop for booking accommodations, activities, and travel plans.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: International Travel Markets Have Picked Up as Vaccines are Distributed
demand_determinants.determinant_description: International travel tends to follow trends in consumer spending and disposable income as these trips cost more than domestic travel. Despite strong international travel demand before the pandemic, travel restrictions and border closures amid the pandemic severely impaired demand from this segment in 2020. To the industry's benefit, international travel rates resurged in 2021 as restrictions were fully removed.

Although office closures, remote work and travel restrictions limited demand during the pandemic, some corporate demand for travel for essential work remained. The shift to using video communication applications such as Zoom and Teams will potentially have a negative implication on demand from corporate clients. Many companies have cut business trips when necessary and opt to use these applications for business meetings.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Advertising Contributes a Growing Industry's Revenue Share
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Besides revenue from consumers and businesses booking hotel reservations, the industry also generates revenue from business advertisements and promoted accommodations and activities. Although many companies have systems to sort search results by the best match to chosen filters, some businesses may pay to be promoted in search results and gain better visibility from potential customers.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast Region holds most establishments. Florida alone houses most theme parks in the region, making the state most popular among tourists. Famous theme parks include Walt Disney World Resort and Universal Orlando Resort.

California dominates the West region. This region is also home to over a quarter of the US population. California hosts most amusement parks nationwide due to its favorable weather. The state also boasts many beautiful beaches in Malibu and Santa Monica. Many tourists travel to California to explore Yosemite National Park and visit the Golden Gate Bridge.
Besides California, the Las Vegas strip in Nevada draws a large number of gamblers and visitors to the state annually. Many tourists visit Las Vegas to gamble and attend entertainment shows.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Most regulations are implemented to prevent deceptive booking practices and ensure data protection.
Although this is state-specific, many companies opt to comply with the most stringent regulations by country.
During the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, the industry had to comply with regulations on travel bans, border closures, quarantine mandates and others.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Revenue volatility level is very high.
Industry assistance level is low and steady.
Capital intensity level is low, which decreases barriers to entry.
Concentration level is low, which decreases barriers to entry.
Globalization level is low but increasing, which decreases barriers to entry.
Competition level is low but increasing, which decreases barriers to entry.
Travel agents need specialized knowledge, which increases barriers to entry.

factors_increased_barrier: Revenue Volatility Level is very high
Industry Assistance Level is low - steady

basis_points.basis_description: Travelers are price sensitive since airfare and accommodation are discretionary purchases.
Travel agencies compete fiercely on price in a highly saturated market where consumers are attracted to the best deal.
The emergence of do-it-yourself platforms is siphoning consumers away from online hotel booking companies.
Vacation rental websites offer direct booking of accommodation and activities while airlines and hotels incentivize consumers to book directly through loyalty and points programs.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry has a low level of concentration.
Companies such as Expedia and Booking operate in the industry through various well-known brands, making it difficult for new entrants to gain market share.

Online hotel booking companies must establish contracts with upstream hotels and suppliers to communicate with reservation systems and ensure accurate availability. These benefits are primarily granted to larger brands.
The industry has undergone substantial merger and acquisition activities.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As quality customer service plays a vital role in retaining customers, companies provide their employees with training to improve employees knowledge and skillsets.
Moving forward, labor expenses will likely decline as a revenue share as companies invest in technologies that help reduce labor expenses.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Travel agents need to have knowledge and understanding of a variety of different regions, seasonal ticket price fluctuations and personalized service
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Travel agents need to have knowledge and understanding of a variety of different regions, seasonal ticket price fluctuations and personalized service

volatility_points.volatility_title: THE ONLINE HOTEL BOOKING INDUSTRY HAS A HIGH REVENUE
volatility_points.volatility_description: THE ONLINE HOTEL BOOKING INDUSTRY HAS A HIGH REVENUE

Before the pandemic, industry demand was bolstered by the increasing use of the Internet in hotel booking and the rising rate of traveling activities. Revenue volatility was relatively low as these drivers boded well with industry growth.

While the travel sector was severely affected by the travel restrictions, falling consumer sentiment and corporate profit also weighed on industry demand significantly amid the pandemic. Travel activities have resumed as the pandemic subsides and the vaccine is rolled out.
A strengthening US dollar, record-high inflation and rising unemployment have collectively depressed consumer confidence, reducing travel demand.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Hotels and other accommodations make up the largest portion of industry revenue
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Hotels and other accommodations make up the largest portion of industry revenue

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Apartment rental services, such as Vrbo, have increased as consumers have demanded additional amenities provided in apartments, such as private residences or a full kitchen.
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Apartment rental services, such as Vrbo, have increased as consumers have demanded additional amenities provided in apartments, such as private residences or a full kitchen.

Despite a strong economy supporting demand for more luxury accommodations, the pandemic resulted in travel restrictions, quarantine mandates, border closures and general consumer concerns about infection. Domestic trips will rebound as the vaccines have been rolled out and consumers return to leisure travel while businesses resume corporate travel.
Finding employees with specialized knowledge can be difficult and costly.

The rate of new patent technologies entering the industry is low, which limits the potential for innovations. A low rate does not mean that innovations cannot occur, just that the likelihood of some innovation materializing as a threat is lower. However, the concentration of technologies is high in this industry. This suggests that industry operators have exposure to potentially unforeseen areas of innovation.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in a niche service or bundle its services to attract clients?
Does your company rely heavily on demand from a single, key market?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators generate demand from domestic and foreign customers.

FAQs.question: What is your company's most significant operational expense?
FAQs.answer: Purchases account for the largest share of industry revenue.

FAQs.question: Does your company target a particular market segment or provide for a broad range of markets?
FAQs.answer: Small operators focus on serving domestic customers, while big online operators focus on serving both domestic and foreign travelers.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce costs through automation?
FAQs.answer: Wages are the second-largest expense for this industry. The industry is still heavily reliant on well-trained and knowledgeable employees to provide high-quality customer service.

FAQs.question: Has investment in new technologies increased your company's competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Some companies have invested in updating their websites to make them more user-friendly. Also, some industry operators also launched mobile applications.

FAQs.question: Is obtaining state certification or licensing necessary for your business?
FAQs.answer: There are no federal requirements for licenses but industry operators must own a business license.

FAQs.question: How do industry operators deal with regulations in this industry? Do these regulations change from state to state?
FAQs.answer: Hotel booking websites endure little-to-no regulation because most regulation is placed directly on hotels.

FAQs.question: How do changes in interest rates impact your business?
FAQs.answer: Tighter financial conditions may weaken demand for travel, while easier conditions may encourage more spending on trips.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margin compare with those of your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies are able to achieve a higher-than-average profit margin compared with small companies.

FAQs.question: How have you been able to build a good reputation?
FAQs.answer: Besides relying on marketing to generate demand, industry operators also benefit from word-of-mouth. Therefore, having a good reputation helps save marketing expenses. In particular, maintaining consistently high-quality customer service builds a good reputation.

FAQs.question: How do you manage room stock availability?
FAQs.answer: Understanding the various room stock and availability is important to prevent overbooking during peak seasons. During low seasons, industry operators run advertisements and offer promotions to fill in vacant rooms.

FAQs.question: Do you have access to the latest and most efficient technology?
FAQs.answer: Online Hotel Booking companies offer reservations and price comparisons on mobile applications and websites.

FAQs.question: Does the Consumer Confidence index play a significant role in the demand in your industry?
FAQs.answer: When consumers are more confident, they are more willing to spend on travel-related activities.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the percentage of services conducted online? How does the percentage of services conducted online affect your business?
FAQs.answer: As internet use increases, people will become more willing to use online hotel booking services. The percentage of services conducted online has grown over the past five years.

FAQs.question: Has your company experienced demand disruption from domestic travel restrictions amid the coronavirus pandemic? How have you adapted your business model?
FAQs.answer: Trends in residents traveling within the United States on overnight trips are key factors influencing revenue for this industry. An increase in domestic trips by US residents typically benefits industry operators since they may use online hotel booking companies to book hotels.
